abstract.p: Los Angeles Modern Auctions will hold auction of 20th-century decorative arts on May 21; photo (Currents) (S)

block.p: Los Angeles Modern Auctions sold a prototype 1941 Conversation armchair by Charles Eames and Eero Saarinen last year for $129,000 -- testament to the demand for midcentury modern on both coasts and in Europe and Japan. For a May 21 sale of 20th-century decorative arts, the auction house has a 1953 lamp by Philip Johnson and Richard Kelly, above, valued at $20,000 to $25,000; a 1958 vase by Ettore Sottsass ($8,000 to $10,000) and resin doors by Gaetano Pesce for the former Chiat/ Day office in New York ($2,000 to $3,000 each), below. Information, (323) 904-1950.
